# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Based on the special instructions provided (which are currently empty), I'll provide a general implementation of the `clean_column` function. If you have specific instructions to add, please do so.

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    # Lowercase and strip leading/trailing whitespaces
    col = lowercase(col)
    col = stripWhitespace(col)

    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    col = replace(col, " ", "_")
    col = replace(col, "-", "_")

    return col
end

# Helper function to strip leading/trailing whitespaces
function stripWhitespace(str)
    str = trimprefix(str, isspace, true))
    str = trimsuffix(str, isspace, true))
    return str
end
```

This code defines a `clean_column` function that cleans the column name according to the provided guidelines. If you have specific instructions, please include them in the `# Special Instructions` section.
